bugs.title: CVE-2021-31215 slurm: environment mishandling in PrologSlurmctld or EpilogSlurmctld script may allow remote code execution

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2021-31215 slurm: environment mishandling in PrologSlurmctld or EpilogSlurmctld script may allow remote code execution

long_desc.thetext:
SchedMD Slurm before 20.02.7 and 20.03.x through 20.11.x before 20.11.7 allows remote code execution as SlurmUser because use of a PrologSlurmctld or EpilogSlurmctld script leads to environment mishandling.

Reference:

https://lists.schedmd.com/pipermail/slurm-announce/2021/000055.html

Created slurm tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-all [bug 1961076]
Affects: fedora-all [bug 1961075]

This CVE Bugzilla entry is for community support informational purposes only as it does not affect a package in a commercially supported Red Hat product. Refer to the dependent bugs for status of those individual community products.

only one tracking bug has been filed, please correct all affected versions

other, you may clone this bug as appropriate.

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an

when new packages are pushed to stable.
